metadata.title: CVE-2018-1302 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
When an HTTP/2 stream was destroyed after being handled, the Apache HTTPServer prior to version 2.4.30 could have written a NULL pointerpotentially to an already freed memory. The memory pools maintained by theserver make this vulnerability hard to trigger in usual configurations, thereporter and the team could not reproduce it outside debug builds, so it isclassified as low risk.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1302` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4').
